body:
Hi! I also replicated this error...thanks @ed-dot-miller for the steps to reproduce it. This is what I found:

1. `helm create test`
2. `cd test`
3. `vim Chart.yaml `[Add the code above]
4. `helm lint`

Result:
```
==> Linting .
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended
[WARNING] /Users/edithpuclla/workspace/practice/test: chart directory is missing these dependencies: trivy-operator

1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed
```

This warning suggests having a _requirement.yaml_ file for dependencies like trivy-operator. I'm not sure if this warning may be different depending on the version you are using.

Yes, as you said, after "helm lint" no mistakes are being shown about unique keys. However, I found something curious in VSC that shows this error about unique keys in appVersion and the dependency.

![Screenshot 2023-09-11 at 16 31 55](https://github.com/helm/helm/assets/58795858/8818f819-f0fc-48a0-b52f-d3ccc1c287a2)


Happy to see your implementation, and also happy to help you test ðŸ˜ƒ

issue.title: fix(pkg/lint): unmarshals Chart.yaml strictly

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
When "helm lint" is run, it now errors on invalid Chart.yaml files, e.g. those with duplicate keys

Closes #12381

**What this PR does / why we need it**: Fixes a bug with the current `helm lint` command, where it does not error on Chart.yaml with duplicate mapping keys

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body:
Thanks @edithturn! Here's the PR if you're interested: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/12382

And yeah, YAML plugins of editors like VSCode are expected to complain in such situations

issue.title: reana.yaml: load parameters from an external file

repository.name: reana
repository.description: REANA: Reusable research data analysis platform

issue.body:
Parameters of a workflow are specified in the `inputs.parameters` section of `reana.yaml`, like this:

```yaml
inputs:
  parameters:
    myparam1: myvalue1
    myparam2: myvalue2
```

However, in case of a CWL or Snakemake workflow, it is also possible to load parameters from an external file by providing a special `input` parameter ([source code](https://github.com/reanahub/reana-commons/blob/f766dd46ecc1a5777e1c8c4dfeb358bec25926ab/reana_commons/specification.py#L97-L104))

```yaml
inputs:
  parameters:
    input: my-parameters.yaml
```

We should introduce a new property in `reana.yaml` to support loading parameters from a file also for serial or Yadage workflows. One possible name for this property can be `parameter_file` (or `parameterfile`):

```yaml
inputs:
  parameter_file: my-parameters.yaml
```

If we want to support multiple parameter files at the same time, then we should use `parameter_files` (or `parameterfiles`) instead:

```yaml
inputs:
  parameter_files:
    - my-parameters-first-stage.yaml
    - my-parameters-second-stage.yaml
```

In this second case, we also need to decide how to handle parameters defined in different files but having the same name.
